a.span: great value but a little cramped...

div.div:
Pros:
very affordable, really good value.
the BIOS is really customizable & flexible.
the board seems really stable.
the back panel plate fit nicely.
Cons:
the memory slots are too close to the CPU so that larger coolers obstruct slots.
Overall, I would buy it again if I needed a rock solid, affordable mother board without many bells & whistles.

div.span: 1 of 1 people found the following review helpful

a.span: Built to last for years and years

div.div: very durable construction, polymer capacitors, great HD sound, lot of USB 3.0 ports, works with Crucial and Samsung SSD's, has old school PCI slots. I've been building computers since the 90's and this fired up on the first try. If you are new to computer building you have to inspect everything first with magnifying glass. make sure there are NO BENT PINS before installing CPU! just one bent pin can cause you a ton of headaches. use canned air and blow off CPU pins and CPU contacts. M.2 is a nice feature but its too new to take advantage of it. only gripe is you have to give up 2 SATA ports to use it. So I just bought a couple of SSD drives instead. With a Haswell processor you'll have a computer that's future proof for at least 7 years

div.span: 3 of 4 people found the following review helpful

div.div:
The video driver I have to use with this is one minor version behind from working 100%.
If you use a Haswell CPU and Debian LXDE then you'll have a minor problem with video.
Edit: Upgrading to Debian 8 (Jessie) allows for proper video driver being loaded in my case; Jessie is stable enough for production in my opinion.
With my USB wireless card I had to use a 2.0 slot. Putting my very cheap 2.0 USB NIC in a 3.0 slot caused problems.
I think the BIOS options are a little lacking. This is my first UEFI; one would expect more standard options than a standard BIOS.
It seems to lean more towards overclocking than other semi-basic features that I'm used to.
The sound driver was a total pain to get working properly, since I need PulseAudio for Skype.
Considering the above is fixable, except for the Intel video driver upgrade to version 2.20, four stars.

a.span: This motherboard is pretty great! Id definitely recommend it to someone who ...

div.div: This motherboard is pretty great! Id definitely recommend it to someone who wants to build their own computer! Unfortunately for me the first one i got worked for about 2 days and i was all excited to get everything I had wanted downloaded onto the computer and get it ready to roll! I ended up calling customer support and talked to a man who had actually built a couple computers before! He was very helpful and only 3 days later i had a new motherboard in hand! Since then the new one has worked flawlessly! Everyone has the chance to get a Dead On Arrival Product especially when dealing with computers! Amazon Support was amazing! This time anyways...

a.span: So far so good! I've had this board installed for a few ...

div.div:
So far so good! I've had this board installed for a few weeks now and I only have one gripe about it:
There is some type of goofiness with the USB 3.0 drivers with this Intel chipset. When they are installed, I have a couple of USB ports in the back that don't work at all. When I revert back to the 2.0 drivers they work fine. I have tried several versions of the Intel drivers but with no luck.
I've installed dozens of boards through the years and I have always been pleased with Gigabyte and their products.

a.span: very good BIOS and a good board for overclocking

div.div: Despite the name, it is smaller than other ATX motherboards. In fact, it did not use up all my ATX holes on Cooler Master HAF 912. No problem whatsoever with this board, really durable, especially I was a bit rough on it. Everything worked perfectly, very good BIOS and a good board for overclocking.
